meanings.sent1: The repetitional exercise helped the students practice the same skill multiple times.
meanings.sent2: Her repetitional behavior of tapping her pencil on the desk annoyed her classmates.
meanings.sent3: The repetitional sound of the clock ticking made the room feel like a time machine.
meanings.sent4: The repetitional pattern of waves crashing on the shore was mesmerizing.
meanings.sent5: The repetitional chant of the fans cheering for their team echoed through the stadium.

meanings.sent1: The song had a repetitional chorus that got stuck in my head.
meanings.sent2: His repetitional jokes always made everyone laugh during lunch.
meanings.sent3: The repetitional ringing of the phone made her wonder if it was broken.
meanings.sent4: The repetitional routine of feeding the ducks at the pond became a daily ritual.
meanings.sent5: The repetitional melody of the music box soothed the baby to sleep.

meanings.sent1: The repetitional task of alphabetizing the books took hours to complete.
meanings.sent2: The repetitional nature of his job made each day feel the same.
meanings.sent3: The repetitional clicking of her heels on the pavement echoed in the empty street.
meanings.sent4: The repetitional cycle of the seasons brought comfort in its predictability.
meanings.sent5: The repetitional motion of the pendulum on the clock was oddly calming.
